text: a handful of plum tomatoes and a few
pantry ingredients that you probably
already have at home are all you need to
make a delicious chill tomato soup
called Salma Rijo
it's a Spanish cousin of gazpacho but
richer in flavor make an X in the bottom
of each tomato and drop them into
boiling water this is just gonna make it
easier to peel the skin they only need
20 to 30 seconds in here and then they
go right into an ice water bath and what
this does is it stops the tomatoes from
cooking and it helps to make the skin
peel right off these are all ready to
come out of the water and I can see that
the skin is already starting to peel
back shocking these in a bowl of ice
water will just cool them down quickly
and prevent them from cooking because
remember this is a raw soup no cooking
involved and I'm gonna let these sit in
here just until they're cool enough to
handle you can see how the skin has
already to separate from the flesh
that's what we're looking for and just
pull it back from the X that you made
earlier this soup originated in a town
called Cordoba in the south of Spain and
I traveled there recently and fell in
love with this soup
I ate it nearly every day and the cool
thing is in every little town in Spain
has their own riff on this soup it's
traditionally topped with hard-boiled
egg and ham own tomatoes appealed and
ready for their moment in the blender
I'm quartering them to make it easier
for them to break down in the blender
you're gonna be amazed at how easily
this all comes together you can make it
a day of head head because it really
should be served nice and cold from the
refrigerator okay so we have our
tomatoes in to that 1/3 cup extra virgin
olive oil be sure you're using a really
good quality olive oil here because
you're going to taste it everything's
raw remember a small clove of garlic and
smash it to make sure that it breaks
down in the machine I like to use the
side of a knife 1/2 a cup of toasted
blanched almonds gives the flavor
richness as well and nuttiness and the
sherry vinegar 1 tablespoon plus a
teaspoon should do and generously season
with salt and pepper the bread gives it
that luscious velvety texture use plain
old white sandwich bread you don't use a
sourdough or
a multigrain or anything that's gonna
bring other flavors into the soup the
bread is really just acting to give the
soup nice body this know is ready to
blend
I just need to let this chill in the
fridge for a few hours and then it's
ready to serve
okay this is ready to serve you can top
the soup with all manner of things
sardines are my personal favorite
they're also a sustainable fish and
really good for you look how gorgeous
that is and I think for the other one
ham very traditional and sprinkling of
egg my mouth is watering like crazy
right now this is a great recipe for
entertaining you can put out a whole
spread to go with your soup let people
choose what they want to put on top so
simple and delicious make this your soup
for summer
